meanings.definition: The state of being captivated or fascinated.
meanings.sent1: Her enchrallments with the magic show were evident in her wide eyes and big smile.
meanings.sent2: The enchrallments of the beautiful sunset left everyone in awe.
meanings.sent3: The enchrallments of the puppy playing with a ball brought joy to the whole family.
meanings.sent4: The enchrallments of the mysterious book kept her up all night reading.
meanings.sent5: The enchrallments of the starry night sky were unforgettable.

meanings.sent1: The museum displayed various enchrallments that caught the visitors' attention.
meanings.sent2: Nature's enchrallments can be found in the smallest details of a flower.
meanings.sent3: The enchrallments of the new video game made him lose track of time.
meanings.sent4: The enchrallments of the city lights at night were like a dream.
meanings.sent5: The enchrallments of the ocean waves crashing against the shore were mesmerizing.
